arm_group.description: Isthmus ablation was performed in paroxysmal atrial fibrillation patients.
Control group was performed no additional cavotricuspid isthmus ablation.

brief_summary.textblock:
It has been demonstrated that successful cavotricuspid isthmus ablation may be effective in
      preventing paroxysmal atrial fibrillation. However, the effectiveness of only isthmus
      ablation on atrial fibrillation itself is unclear.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Cavotricuspid Isthmus Ablation in Patients Without History of Typical Flutter During Ablation

detailed_description.textblock:
Researchers hypothesized that an organized activation pattern around the tricuspid annulus
      during atrial fibrillation indicated a mother reentrant circuit that could be terminated by
      a cavocaval isthmus ablation, thus preventing atrial fibrillation. The objectives of the
      present study were to evaluate the effectiveness of isthmus ablation in preventing atrial
      fibrillation and to identify predictors of its success.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Scheduled ablation for paroxysmal atrial fibrillation

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Typical atrial flutter

          -  History of artificial tricuspid valve surgery

intervention.description: Isthmus ablation was performed in paroxysmal atrial fibrillation patients.
Control group was performed no additional cavotricuspid isthmus ablation.

clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Cavotricuspid Isthmus Ablation in Patients Without History of Typical Flutter During Ablation for Paroxysmal Atrial Fibrillation

primary_outcome.description: 1 month, 3 months and 12months after ablation follow up visit and Check the recurrence of atrial fibrillation through EKG,Holter, event recording

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Subject), Primary Purpose: Treatment
